Capital gains tax: Where the political parties stand https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/capital-gains-tax-where-the-political-parties-stand/2RNUBDGC3NGYNNBOTQP5TRD7HA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/capital-gains-tax-where-the-political-parties-stand/2RNUBDGC3NGYNNBOTQP5TRD7HA/ ANZ’s boss the latest voice in a growing chorus calling for a capital gains or wealth tax. Thu, 26 Sep 2024 04:15:13 +0000 Prime Minister Christopher Luxon laughed off calls from ANZ chief executive Antonia Watson, who said she supported the tax, while Nicola Willis believed a capital gains tax would detract people from investing. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Weather: Severe stormy conditions for South Island, sun for start of school holidays https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/weather-severe-stormy-conditions-for-south-island-sun-for-start-of-school-holidays/VRARIM6FQ5DFDACFLA3NXAQFIA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/weather-severe-stormy-conditions-for-south-island-sun-for-start-of-school-holidays/VRARIM6FQ5DFDACFLA3NXAQFIA/ Raphael FranksTemperatures are also due to plunge by 15C; bad weather will move north on Friday. Thu, 26 Sep 2024 03:34:00 +0000 There are 10 weather warnings and watches active until Friday night. Auckland and other northern areas will get a dousing tomorrow before fine weather sets in again in time for the start of the school holidays.

Major piling finished on massive SH1/Mangamuka repair job in Far North https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/major-piling-finished-on-massive-sh1mangamuka-repair-job-in-far-north/PPMKISRMQVAFRIANW5RO5QOHDA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/major-piling-finished-on-massive-sh1mangamuka-repair-job-in-far-north/PPMKISRMQVAFRIANW5RO5QOHDA/ Mike DinsdaleSH1 over the Mangamukas in the Far North is on track for a pre-Christmas opening.
